paper_abstract: With the hope of discovering effective analgesics with fewer side effects, attention has recently shifted to allosteric modulators of the opioid receptors. In the past two years, the first chemotypes of positive or silent allosteric modulators (PAMs or SAMs, respectively) of mu- and delta-opioid receptor types have been reported in the literature. During a structure-guided lead optimization campaign with mu-PAMs BMS-986121 and BMS-986122 as starting compounds, we discovered a new chemotype that was confirmed to display mu-PAM or mu-SAM activity depending on the specific substitutions as assessed by endomorphin-1-stimulated beta-arrestin2 recruitment assays in Chinese Hamster Ovary (CHO)-mu PathHunter cells. The most active mu-PAM of this series was analyzed further in competition binding and G-protein activation assays to understand its effects on ligand binding and to investigate the nature of its probe dependence.
paper_title: Ligand-Based Discovery of a New Scaffold for Allosteric Modulation of the mu-Opioid Receptor
